snippet: The strong performance of a Republican in a district where Hispanics make up the majority and registered Republicans trail Democrats by 22 percentage points is seen as a road map to a turnaround.
abstract: California Republican officials are seizing on strong performance of Republican Andy Vidak for special election in State Senate as road map to a turnaround in their party's fortunes; district in question has a majority of Hispanic voters, and Vidak failed to avoid a runoff by about 150 votes.
lead_paragraph: The strong performance of a Republican in a district where Hispanics make up the majority and registered Republicans trail Democrats by 22 percentage points is seen as a road map to a turnaround.

headline.main: California Republicans, All but Endangered, See Hope in Local Race
headline.print_headline: California Republicans, All but Endangered, See Hope in Local Race
